title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, but the Celtics fell to the Magic 123-110, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Magic made 17 three-pointers at a 47.2% rate, while Celtics struggled from deep, affecting their offensive performance.
Despite Payton Pritchard's 5-for-8 shooting from three points, the Celtics were outscored 28-14 after a crucial turnover.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces a public reprimand for creating an 'appearance of impropriety' in a 2018 incident.
Hearing officer Denis J. McInerney found no evidence that Joseph authorized a migrant's escape from ICE custody.
Federal charges against Joseph for obstruction of justice were dropped in 2022; a state investigation was pursued instead.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: The Red Sox lost to the Yankees in the AL Wild Card Series, ending their postseason after one win.
Shortstop Trevor Story opted into his contract, while third baseman Alex Bregman opted out of his.
Manager Alex Cora expresses optimism for the future, citing organizational progress despite a challenging season.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A blade from a 300-foot wind turbine detached and landed in a cranberry bog in Plymouth, no injuries reported.
The incident was reported around 2 p.m. Friday; the blade measured 75 to 100 feet and was found hundreds of feet away.
Police and maintenance crews ensured the turbine shut down safely, with investigators looking into the cause of the failure.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Marvel introduces 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps,' streaming on Disney+, marking a new phase for the MCU.
Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' adapts Mary Shelley's novel with unique twists, now streaming on Netflix.
'Squid Game: The Challenge' Season 2 continues on Netflix, featuring 456 contestants competing for a $4 million prize.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims to improve his attitude, striving for perfection as part of his competitive edge.
Diggs leads the Patriots in several receiving categories, contributing significantly to the team's current success.
He credits coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing for fostering a growth-oriented and encouraging environment.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA commuter train collided with an empty car on the tracks in Acton near Central Street Thursday evening.
The car's driver exited before the collision, which occurred around 5:30 p.m., and will be cited by police.
The crash caused delays on the Fitchburg line, with Train 1427 terminated at South Acton due to the incident.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox are considering Japanese star Munetaka Murakami, a top free agent, as he's posted for MLB transfer by Tokyo Yakult Swallows.
Murakami, nicknamed the 'Japanese Babe Ruth,' set an NPB single-season home run record with 56 homers in 2022.
Speculations suggest Murakami could play third base, first base, or be a designated hitter for the Red Sox if Alex Bregman departs.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: The FAA reduced flights by 10% at 40 airports, including Logan, due to the government shutdown.
Airlines like JetBlue, Southwest, and United are waiving change fees and offering refunds for affected customers.
Massport advises passengers to check with airlines for potential delays and cancellations at Logan Airport.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A crash on Cape Cod involving an e-bike has sparked debate over tougher e-bike regulations in Massachusetts.
In a Boston.com poll, 78% of readers supported stricter e-bike rules, citing growing safety concerns.
Massachusetts divides e-bikes into two classes, allowing them on most trails and roads with no license required.
